title: John 1: Jesus Is the Premortal Christ and Creator
short_title: John 1: Jesus Is the Premortal Christ and Creator
content: Jesus Is the Premortal Christ and Creator

Matthew, Mark, and Luke began their accounts by telling about Jesus’ birth or baptism. John began his Gospel differently. In the first chapter John combined his testimony with that of John the Baptist to tell about who Jesus was even before He came to earth.
The Lord revealed many changes for

to the Prophet Joseph Smith. Those changes are in the Joseph Smith Translation appendix at the back of the Bible (pp. 807–8). It is helpful to read the first part of this chapter from the Joseph Smith Translation.

Elder James E. Talmage taught that Jesus was the one “through whom the will, commandment, or word of the Father was put into effect” (

33). He represents Heavenly Father the way a word represents an idea. Just as a word could be considered the messenger of a thing or an idea, Christ was the messenger of the Father and of His gospel, which is a plan of salvation for all mankind.
